title: Citi, the New York Mets and the Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi to Partner with Dress for Success to Celebrate Mothers' Day Weekend
summary: New York – Citi, the New York Mets and the Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi today announced that they will partner with Dress for Success (DFS), an organization that promotes the economic independence of disadvantaged women. They will support DFS's objectives during Mothers' Day weekend, along with Mets legends John Franco, George Foster, Edgardo Alfonzo, Kevin Elster, Ed Hearn and George Theodore, who will participate in special events throughout the weekend, including appearances at local Citi branches and other activities.
tag-1: Citi, the New York Mets and the Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi to Partner with Dress for Success to Celebrate Mothers' Day Weekend
tag-3: New York – Citi, the New York Mets and the Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi today announced that they will partner with Dress for Success (DFS), an organization that promotes the economic independence of disadvantaged women. They will support DFS's objectives during Mothers' Day weekend, along with Mets legends John Franco, George Foster, Edgardo Alfonzo, Kevin Elster, Ed Hearn and George Theodore, who will participate in special events throughout the weekend, including appearances at local Citi branches and other activities.
tag-4: The Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi was created in 2010 to expand financial inclusion and economic empowerment in local underserved communities while honoring Mets history. In partnership with Citi Community Development and local non-profit organizations, former Mets players participate in various special events throughout the year as part of this initiative.
tag-5: "We are thrilled to go to bat with these great Mets alumni as we honor women everywhere on Mother's Day weekend," said Linda Descano, President and CEO of Citi's Women & Co., a financial education resource and community for women. "Mothers who contribute to and manage their family's finances have a significant social and economic impact on future generations. We commend Dress for Success for providing women with the resources to help them succeed at work and in life. Our work with outstanding partners like Dress for Success reinforces our commitment to the community and is representative of our long-held belief to pay tribute to those who help and empower others."
tag-6: Citi Community Development supports Dress for Success' Financial Literacy initiative in seven markets throughout the U.S. This comprehensive program is geared toward women who have been working for at least one year and are committed to improving their financial lives. These interactive sessions are action-oriented and address real-life personal finance issues, and Citi employee volunteers across the U.S. use their financial expertise to teach the sessions.
tag-7: The Dress for Success festivities will begin tonight, when the Mets Alumni and Citi executives present Dress for Success volunteer Carole Coleman with the "Teammates in the Community Award" during a special ceremony, before the Mets host the Los Angeles Dodgers at 7:10 p.m. at Citi Field. The award recognizes individuals who have demonstrated extraordinary ways to give back to the community, and Coleman, who has been a volunteer with Dress for Success for nearly 10 years, will be honored for her exemplary commitment and dedication to serving and helping others.
tag-8: On Saturday, May 7, Citi and the Mets will support and participate in the "The Power Walk for Dress for Success" in Manhattan's Battery Park. Mets alumni Franco, as well as Foster and Theodore – and their wives – will join in the 5K walk. Proceeds from the walk will go to support the work of Dress for Success. To participate in the walk or to learn more about Dress for Success, visit www.dfspowerwalk.org or www.citicommunitydevelopments.com/dfs.
tag-9: "Dress for Success empowers disadvantaged women to become healthy in all aspects of their lives," said Joi Gordon, CEO of Dress for Success Worldwide. "It's through important partnerships, such as the Citi/Dress for Success relationship, that we are able to take our message of empowerment and economic independence beyond the walls of our branches and directly into the community. We are honored, grateful, and excited to have Citi, The New York Mets, and The Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi join us to celebrate and empower our women this Mother's Day weekend."
tag-10: Citi is proud to make an impact on the lives of its customers and their communities. For example, Citi has provided thousands of kids with an once-in-a-lifetime experience, combining education and baseball, through its Citi Field Kids program via its relationship with the New York Mets benefitting United Neighborhood Houses of New York. This year, the YMCA will also be a beneficiary of the program.
tag-11: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 140 countries. Through Citicorp and Citi Holdings, Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com or www.citi.com.
tag-12: Citi Community Development Citi Community Development (CCD) is leading Citi's commitment to achieve economic empowerment and growth for underserved individuals, families and communities by expanding access to financial products and services, and building sustainable business solutions and innovative partnerships. Our focus areas include: commercial and philanthropic funding; innovative financial products and services; and collaborations with institutions that expand access to financial products and services for low-income and underserved communities. For more information, please visit www.citigroup.com/community.
tag-13: Dress for Success Dress for Success is an international not-for-profit organization that promotes the economic independence of disadvantaged women by providing professional attire, a network of support and the career development tools to help women thrive in work and in life. Since 1997, Dress for Success has expanded to more than 110 cities around the world and has helped more than 550,000 women work towards self-sufficiency.
